oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Roy Acuff's Royal Crown sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number one of an unidentified number. The tape features multiple recordings. The recording features Grant Turner (host) and features performances by: Tommy Jackson (musician), Lonnie Wilson (musician), Roy Acuff (musician/host), Smokey Mountain Boys (musical group), Uncle Dave Macon (musician), Pap and his Jug Band (musical group), and Jimmie Riddle (musician). The tape is from a multitude of dates from: October 31, 1947; November 08, 1947; and November 15, 1947.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tommy Jackson; Lonnie Wilson; Grant Turner; Roy Acuff; Smokey Mountain Belles; Uncle Dave Macon; Jimmie Riddle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Sally Goodin (Tommy Jackson and Lonnie Wilson) -- (00:31) Sally Goodin (Tommy Jackson and Lonnie Wilson) -- (01:50) Fire on the Mountain (Tommy Jackson) -- (02:13) Done Gone (Tommy Jackson) -- (03:09) American Ace Opening Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (04:03) My Old Pal of Yesterday (Roy Acuff) -- (06:44) The End of the World (Smokey Mountain Belles) -- (08:40) Roy Acuff and Grant Turner perform an American Ace commercial spot -- (09:30) Dusty Miller (Tommy Jackson) -- (10:49) Bully of the Town (Uncle Dave Macon) -- (12:36) The Great Titanic (Roy Acuff) -- (15:42) Wonderful World (Pap and his Jug Band) -- (18:04) If I Could Hear My Mother Pray Again (Roy Acuff) -- (20:59) Turner performs an American Ace commercial spot -- (21:49) American Ace Opening Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] (Roy Acuff) -- (22:55) Little Pal (Roy Acuff) -- (25:15) They'll be a Hillbilly Wedding in June (Smokey Mountain Belles) -- (26:53) Turner performs an American Ace commercial spot -- (28:08) Memphis Blues (Jimmie Riddle) -- (29:31) Blue Eyes Cryin' in the Rain (Roy Acuff)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Tommy; Wilson, Lonnie; Turner, Grant; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Belles; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982;
